intro: Ilex magnifructa var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf holly, is a compact evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features glossy, dark green leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have spiny margins. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to form dense, low-growing thickets.
